title: Plants Tha Thrive in Low Light
excerpt: Snake plant, ZZ plant and pothos grow well with little sunlight.
content: Low-light plants are ideal for apartments and offices,Snake plants,pothos, and ZZ plants can survive with minimal sunlight,making them perfect for rooms without direct window.

title: Best Watering Schedule
excerpt: Water only when the top inch of soil feels dry.
content: Overwatering is the most common mistake in plant care. Always check the soil before watering. If the top layer is dry, it’s time to water; if not, wait a bit longer.

title: How to Care for Succulents
excerpt: Use well-draining soil and avoid frequent watering.
content: Succulents store water in their leaves and need infrequent watering. Use cactus soil and pots with drainage holes to prevent root rot.

title: Why Drainage Holes Matter
excerpt: Good drainage prevents root rot and plant diseases.
content: Pots without drainage holes trap excess water, causing roots to rot. Always choose pots with drainage or add a drainage layer at the bottom.

title: How to Increase Humidity for Plants
excerpt: Some plants need more humidity to thrive.
content: Tropical plants like Calathea and Ferns prefer higher humidity. You can increase humidity by misting leaves, using a humidifier, or placing a tray of water nearby.

title: Signs You Are Overwatering
excerpt: Yellow leaves and soggy soil are warning signs.
content: Overwatered plants often show yellowing leaves, drooping, and moldy soil. Reduce watering and ensure proper drainage to help the plant recover.

title: Signs You Are Underwatering
excerpt: Dry soil and wilting leaves mean your plant needs water.
content: When plants lack water, leaves may curl, wilt, or turn brown at the edges. Water thoroughly until excess water drains from the pot.

title: When and Why to Repot Plants
excerpt: Repot when roots outgrow the container.
content: Repot plants every 1–2 years or when roots come out of drainage holes. This gives roots more space and refreshes nutrients in the soil.

title: Choosing the Right Soil
excerpt: Different plants need different soil types.
content: Succulents prefer sandy soil, while tropical plants need rich, well-draining soil. Using the correct soil improves plant health and growth.

title: Why You Should Clean Plant Leaves
excerpt: Clean leaves help plants photosynthesize better.
content: Dust on leaves blocks sunlight. Gently wipe leaves with a damp cloth every few weeks to keep plants healthy and shiny.

title: Pet-Friendly Plants
excerpt: Choose plants that are safe for cats and dogs.
content: Some common plants are toxic to pets. Safe options include Spider Plant, Areca Palm, and Calathea. Always check toxicity before buying.

title: Fertilizing Basics
excerpt: Plants need nutrients to grow strong.
content: Use a balanced fertilizer during the growing season (spring and summer). Avoid over-fertilizing, which can damage roots.

title: Rotate Plants for Even Growth
excerpt: Turning pots helps plants grow evenly.
content: Plants grow toward light sources. Rotate pots every few weeks to prevent leaning and encourage balanced growth.

title: Seasonal Plant Care Tips
excerpt: Plants have different needs in each season.
content: In winter, most plants need less water and no fertilizer. In spring and summer, increase watering and feeding as growth resumes.

title: Common Indoor Plant Pests
excerpt: Learn how to spot and treat pests early.
content: Common pests include spider mites, aphids, and fungus gnats. Inspect leaves regularly and treat infestations early with natural remedies or insecticidal soap.
